text:
(3)
this worder in the same manner it happen'd, as follows.

At East-Bishford, in the Parish of Bedminster two
miles from Bristol in the County of Summerset, on
Munday the third of July last past, at the house of
one Blianor Holder Widdow, this strange Accident
happen'd, being first taken notice of thus, The
said widdow and four of her daughters and three
neighbours being altogether, on asudden they
heard a cry of a Kitling or young Cat which the woman
of the house wondered at because her Cat
having Kittend the week before, she or some of her
people had caused all the young ones to be drowned;
But this cry continuing, made them look very
Diligently about the house, but could not a good
while find from whence it proceeded, At last observing
it came from under a Dresser Tho. Holbrook,
a young lad going to look there saw a Hen sitting,
and thinking the Cat might be hid behind her,
Hu'sht her away, who thereupon comming forth
into the Room, one of the maids that owned the
Hen, looking upon her, cried out what has this fellow
done? he has spoil'd my Hen, see all her Guts
are comming out; for so she at first glance apprehended,
but when they began to look more near
and
